intro: Orthodon scaber, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically rough to the touch due to their dense pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Orthodon scaber is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological roles.
